strings: <se_low>Yangus: There's a sort of grassy smell comin' from this little cave, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I can't say as I'm all that keen on it, really.
<se_high>Jessica: That's weird. I don't think there's a fire or anything, but I feel warm.

<se_high>Jessica: Is that because of all the nook grass?
What an unusual place!
<se_def>Angelo: These must be the ruins the old woman, Marta, looks after.
<se_def>Angelo: She's certainly careful, what with the iron bars and everything.<page>Angelo: But I can't help feeling she's a little bit too careful. There doesn't seem to be much of value here.
<se_low>Yangus: Judgin' by the racket just now, that ain't no normal pack o' wolves, guv!
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should get ourselves ready for a bit of a scrap, just in case?

<se_low>Yangus: It's good that the old woman's safe.
Wot a relief!
<se_low>Yangus: I wouldn't fancy 'avin' to face Marek if anyfin' 'ad 'appened to 'er!
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe the old woman's 'idin' in 'ere somewhere.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's go in an' 'ave a proper look 'round.

<se_high>Jessica: So long as we stay within the barrier, we're safe.
But that noise worries me.

<se_high>Jessica: What do you think?
Should we go outside and see what it is?

<se_high>Jessica: This is a very powerful barrier.
I can tell.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder if it's like the one that Dominico made back in Arcadia?

<se_high>Jessica: What's this!?
I thought the end of this passage was barred off!

<se_high>Jessica: It seems to be open now.
When did that happen?
<se_def>Angelo: Maybe that roaring before was a trap designed to lure us out?

<se_def>Angelo: We're safe in here.
The wolves can't get to us through the barrier.
So maybe we should just stay put for a while.
<se_def>Angelo: We could always have a chat with Marta to kill a bit of time?
<se_def>Angelo: At the very least, we should tell her that we gave that bag of nook grass to Marek.
<se_def>Angelo: If Marta came in here, she could be in trouble.

<se_def>Angelo: It's a dead end, right?
There's nowhere to run.
We should prepare ourselves for the worst.
<se_low>King Trode: Shall we investigate those monuments Marek told us about, then?

<se_low>King Trode: I doubt very much that it will be of any use,
but we should at least show a bit of good will.
<se_low>King Trode: Wherever do you suppose this ‘Godbird Island’ is located?
<se_low>King Trode: Hm, I've no idea. Let's prioritise finding the black dog first, and attend to this later.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh! I'm well narked now!
I thought we'd finally caught up with that black mongrel, an' then 'e went an' flew off!
<se_low>Yangus: An' we couldn't save that old babushka woman neither... I've never felt so useless in me 'ole life!

<se_low>Yangus: Oh! I'm well narked now!
I thought we'd finally caught up with that black mongrel, an' then 'e went an' flew off!
<se_low>Yangus: An' we couldn't save that old babushka woman neither... I've never felt so useless in me 'ole life!
<se_high>Jessica: I've heard stories about the Godbird Empyrea before, but I never really believed them.
<se_high>Jessica: Then again, I thought Rhapthorne was a mythical being, too. So I suppose it's just as likely that Empyrea is real.
<se_high>Jessica: I've heard stories about the Godbird Empyrea before, but I never really believed them.
<se_high>Jessica: Then again, I thought Rhapthorne was a mythical being, too. So I suppose it's just as likely that Empyrea is real.
<se_def>Angelo: Come to think of it, Marta gave us that key, didn't she?
<se_def>Angelo: Seeing as we don't know where that dog's got to, we may as well open the door and have a look around while we're here.
<se_def>Angelo: Come to think of it, Marta gave us that key, didn't she?
<se_def>Angelo: Seeing as we don't know where that dog's got to, we may as well open the door and have a look around while we're here.
<se_def>Angelo: Personally, my favourite playgrounds are casinos or anywhere I can admire a beautiful maiden. So, shall we?
<se_low>Yangus: You plannin' on visitin' the old woman's grave or somefin'?
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't got nuffin' wiv us, no flowers or NUFFIN'! ...But I'm sure she'll still be pleased to see us. Come on, let's go!
<se_low>Yangus: Fair enough. I s'pose we should wait 'til ev'ryfin's sorted out before we go an' see 'er.
<se_high>Jessica: So, the great sage who created the stone monuments also made this barrier to protect them from evil.
<se_high>Jessica: It certainly lives up to its reputation as the work of a great sage. Even after all these years, its power remains undiminished.

<se_def>Angelo: The barrier gives off a lot of heat.
I bet that's why it's the only place nook grass can easily be grown.
<se_def>Angelo: No wonder Marek wasn't having any luck trying to establish it in that cave.
<se_low>Yangus: It makes me feel awful seein' ev'ryfin' burnt to the ground. Reminds me of wot 'appened 'ere.

<se_high>Jessica: Remember when we stayed here for a while,
to get out of the snow?
That feels like ages ago now.
<se_high>Jessica: It's still hard to believe that Marta and her wonderful house are gone.
<se_def>Angelo: Have you come back here to dwell on what happened? To try and salve your conscience or something?
<se_def>Angelo: Well, I can't stop you, but I'd rather not be forced into thinking about it myself.
<se_low>Yangus: It must be a bit 'ard for the old woman livin' all the way out 'ere on 'er own, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I wonder why she don't go an' live in that town at the bottom of the mountains she told us about.
<se_high>Jessica: I wonder what kind of relationship Marta and Marek have?
<se_high>Jessica: Since she's the herb expert, I suppose it's like a master and apprentice sort of thing.
<se_def>Angelo: Marta said people have lived here generation after generation guarding these ruins.
<se_def>Angelo: It all sounds a bit like a fairy tale, don't you think? An old woman protecting mysterious ruins in remote, snowy mountains...
<se_def>Angelo: It's a shame the heroine is an old woman rather than a nubile young beauty, though.
<se_low>King Trode: So that pest of a dog flew off to the east.
<se_low>King Trode: If I remember rightly, Savella Cathedral lies to the east of here. Why don't we try going there first?
<se_low>Yangus: There's not much left of Marta's 'ouse, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: It's terrible seein' it all burnt to the ground like this. Makes me feel awful that I couldn't do nuffin' to save 'er, like.
<se_high>Jessica: Rhapthorne's plot to break the seal of the sceptre has claimed the lives of six of the great sages' heirs.

<se_high>Jessica: There's only one left.
We must protect the life of the final heir.
No matter the cost.
<se_def>Angelo: I can understand that Marek's grieving for his mother. But there are lots of people waiting for him back in Orkutsk.
<se_def>Angelo: He needs to try and pull himself together for their sakes.

<se_def>Angelo: It's nice to be needed like that.
Or so I imagine.

<se_low>Yangus: So we're 'ere at last.
D'ya think the old woman's okay?
<se_low>Yangus: Oh, I can't take the suspense!
Yangus: That black dog's an evil mongrel! Usin' Marek to lure the poor old woman outside like that!
Yangus: Grr! Well, 'e won't get away wiv it! I'll get revenge for Marta if it's the last thing I do!

<se_high>Jessica: It's so quiet...
Does that mean nothing's going to happen?
Or is this just the calm before the storm?

Jessica: This is no time for chit-chat!
We've got to deal with that mangy mutt!

<se_def>Angelo: Everything looks quite normal from outside,
at any rate.

<se_def>Angelo: But you never can tell with Rhapthorne.
I hope Marta's all right...
Angelo: Let's face it, we've been through all this and we still haven't really achieved anything.
Angelo: ...No! I shouldn't talk like that! It's not over yet! If we can just defeat that dog and retrieve the sceptre...
<se_low>Yangus: I reckon it's a good idea, comin' 'ere before we fight Rhapthorne.
<se_low>Yangus: When I see the burnt-out remains o' Marta's old 'ouse, it makes me all fired up about not bein' able to save 'er! Now I'm ready for a scrap!
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe that we fought a big battle here.

<se_high>Jessica: So many things have happened since then.
It feels like so long ago.
<se_def>Angelo: I can understand you wanting to take a trip down memory lane.<page>Angelo: But maybe saving the world from Rhapthorne should be our first priority at the moment.

<se_def>Angelo: Still, I know how you like your detours.
It's impressive how you still make time for them even when there's an apocalypse in the offing.
<se_low>Yangus: We may 'ave defeated that dog, but I still don't really feel like we got revenge for Marta dyin' like that.
<se_low>Yangus: We should polish off Rhapthorne once an' for all before we go visitin' 'er grave. Make sure we've got somefin' good to tell 'er, like.
<se_high>Jessica: The great sage must have left these monuments because he knew the Lord of Darkness would return one day.<page>Jessica: He created them to warn future generations.
<se_high>Jessica: If you think about it that way, we failed him, because Rhapthorne is back.

<se_high>Jessica: ...But he hasn't conquered the world yet!
If we give it our all, there's still a chance we can stop him!
<se_def>Angelo: Looks like Marek's doing a good job of tending Marta's herb garden.
<se_def>Angelo: It would've been a shame to just let them wither and die after she put so much effort into growing them here.<page>Angelo: It's good that there's someone to take over.
<se_low>Yangus: Did you 'ear that!?
<se_low>Yangus: We've got a winner! There's gotta be a sage's orb 'round 'ere somewhere!
<se_high>Jessica: An echo! That means one of the orbs has to be around here! Let's find it!
<se_def>Angelo: Unless I'm mistaken or that flute's broken...
<se_def>Angelo: There's an orb nearby! Shall we go and find it?
<se_low>Yangus: Poor old Marta was one o' them sage 'eirs, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: For 'er sake, we should make sure we get all them orbs an' knock Rhapthorne's block off!
<se_high>Jessica: According to Empyrea, the seven orbs contain the power of the great sages' bloodlines.
<se_high>Jessica: The heirs to the seven sages may have been killed, but their spirits live on inside the orbs.<page>Jessica: That means Alistair and Marta will be fighting right alongside us.
<se_def>Angelo: If you don't know where to find the orbs, you'd be better off using the echo flute than asking me for advice.
<se_def>Angelo: Don't worry. I doubt it'll cause an avalanche. Give it a try.
<se_def>Angelo: If you think about it, we seem to have become Empyrea's lackeys.
<se_def>Angelo: I know we would've had to find a way to defeat Rhapthorne anyway...but I do find this menial labour a bit hard to swallow. Hah!
<se_low>Morrie: Even here, in all the snow <endash> fighting against the elephants <endash> the lady looks after the ruins, ay? She must be a woman of PASSION!
<se_low>Morrie: I would like to help this lady.
<se_low>Morrie: Che? What was that? I hear a noise coming from the hut!

<se_low>Morrie: We must be careful. It may be a trap!
We go, but we be prepared for fighting, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Thanks to the Goddess, the signora Marta is not hurt, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: But now, we are <endash> How do you say? <endash> up the creek without the saddle, ay? We escape into a place with no escape! It is dead at the end!
<se_low>Morrie: Per favore, almighty Goddess, let the kind signora Marta be safe!
<se_low>Morrie: The black canine demonio coward! It makes the homicide, and then runs away to the sky so it does not have to face our music, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Enough! Morrie Mozzarella is now estremamente cheesed off! We look for the Godbird, ay? Allora, let's go!
<se_low>Morrie: The black canine demonio coward! It makes the homicide, and then runs away to the sky so it does not have to face our music, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Enough! Morrie Mozzarella is now estremamente cheesed off! We look for the Godbird, ay? Allora, let's go!
<se_low>Morrie: Pity... Such a pity...
<se_low>Morrie: When I come here to this place, these words, they just plop into my head, ay. I don't know why.

<se_high>Red: Looks like there's been a big fire 'ere, eh?
Prob'ly that Lord o' Darkness up to more tricks.
<se_low>Morrie: Pity... Such a pity...
<se_low>Morrie: When I come here to this place, these words, they just plop into my head, ay. I don't know why.

<se_low>Morrie: When I was hearing the signora was living
in this place in the mountains by herself,
I was worried.
<se_low>Morrie: But she had so much PASSION! Even alone, she protected what she must protect, ay? Si, she was a sensazione!
<se_low>Morrie: Pity... Such a pity...
<se_low>Morrie: When I come here to this place, these words, they just plop into my head, ay. I don't know why.

<se_low>Morrie: What is happening inside the house, ay?
We must find out. We must be courageous!
<se_high>Red: So this is another place where one o' them great sages lived, is it?

<se_high>Red: And now it's just a heap of ash...
That Rhapthorne's a piece o' work, eh?
A real nasty piece o' work.
<se_low>Morrie: The Lord of the Darkness has taken many lives, ay? He makes the shadow over the whole world.
<se_low>Morrie: But we cannot change the past. Now we must think only of how we defeat the Rhapthorne and stop more sad things.
<se_high>Red: Ruins guarded by one o' the great sages, eh? Sounds like a place worth investigatin' for treasure. ...But I ain't really in the mood.
<se_low>Morrie: It is warm here, even with all of the snowing outside. Si, this place makes you feel safe, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Va bene! We must be ruins like these ourselves! We must make the people of the world feel safe again by fighting the Rhapthorne with all of our GUSTO!
